strings.Value: {g|Stability2_1}[Choice effects]{/g} "I order the guard doubled in all settlements."
{g|Stability2_2}[Choice effects]{/g} "I order a curfew."
{g|Stability2_3}[Choice effects]{/g} "Let them get used to taking care of themselves."
"You're the Warden – you know what to do."

{n}Kesten bows hastily and starts talking right away.{/n} "Bandit attacks continue in your {mf|barony|barony|kingdom|kingdom}. In some places, the people are scared of leaving their houses even at dusk, not to mention in the dead of night."
"As your Warden, I recommend we double the number of guards. That will allow us to keep the situation under control. I will arm everyone I can, and hasten their training."
{n}Ekun looks sullen.{/n} "There's disaster. Everywhere. The Stag Lord may be gone, but there's still much trouble in your lands. Robbing and killing on the roads..."
"You must do something. Protect the people. My advice? A curfew. Announce a time of night when people remain inside their homes. My guard will maintain order."

{n}The half-orc grins darkly.{/n} "Sometimes your subjects make me wonder. They live in the {g|Stolen Lands}Stolen Lands{/g}. They've always got plenty of bandits around, but they start families here, they raise their kids – all while they keep complaining that the bandits won't let them live! And they don't ever leave!"

"Well, the peasants finally got to me with all their nagging about bandits. But I'm fine, I can handle it. I've just got to try to ignore them. I've already lived here long enough to understand: as soon as the locals realize no one is going to protect them, they'll stop whining and take up arms themselves. Give them a chance to show their worth!"
"Will do, {mf|Your Grace|Your Grace|Your Highness|Your Highness}!"
"You know what's best."
{n}Regongar cringes with disgust.{/n} "So the guards will loiter in the streets rather than clearing out the bandits' lairs? Your barony won't go far at this rate!"
"Right. I will give the order."
"At least your subjects won't be crowding the streets like useless sheeple."

"{mf|Your Grace|Your Grace|Your Highness|Your Highness}! We can't just... lock people up in their houses and hope that the violence will stop!" {n}Kesten shakes his head, but decides not to continue.{/n}
"They will fail. And when the criminals finish robbing people on the streets, they'll start breaking into their homes. This is a bad decision."
"Exactly." {n}Regongar cracks his fingers, as if he's preparing for a fight himself.{/n}
"I will immediately start looking for new guards, and dispatch units to the farthest reaches of the {mf|barony|barony|kingdom|kingdom}."
"I will announce time of night when the people should keep themselves inside."
"Like I said – nothing. You'll see, these petitioners can handle everything themselves."
{n}Kesten shakes his head, but doesn't argue.{/n}
